intro: Weinmannia obtusifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California, where it thrives in sandy soils and mild climates. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to local biodiversity. Due to its ecological significance and unique adaptations, it is considered an important species for conservation efforts in its native range.
